sub_topic: Determining the volume of a cone.
message_1: What is the volume of a cone with a radius of 7 cm and a height of 10 cm? (Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.)
message_2:
The formula to find the volume of a cone is V = (1/3)πr²h, where V is the volume, r is the radius, and h is the height.

In this case, the radius (r) is 7 cm and the height (h) is 10 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

V = (1/3)π(7)²(10)
V = (1/3)π(49)(10)
V = (1/3)π(490)

Now, we can calculate the volume:

V ≈ (1/3)(3.14159)(490)
V ≈ 513.665

Rounding to the nearest hundredth, the volume of the cone is approximately 513.67 cubic centimeters.
